title: Sony Mastering Requirement PS4: R4008A - Voice recognition title name for booting application
custom_preconds:
Requirement: The voice recognition title name for booting the application included in pronunciation.xml in the master package file is one of the following.
 - Title name
 - Part of the title name
 - Shortened title name (some of the characters that comprise the title are included)


Description
pronunciation.xml can be created/edited using "Voice Recognition Title Name" included with SDK Manager. For details on "Voice Recognition Title Name", refer to "Voice Recognition Title Name User's Guide". Up to three voice recognition title names can be set for each language supported by voice recognition.

To avoid end user confusion, a number representing a series or a number/expression representing a year alone must be prevented from being set as a voice recognition title name. Because there are many applications that include "2015", "III", and "2K14"; when only setting these as voice recognition texts, multiple applications will be applicable and user experience will be compromised.

Note that languages according to sales region are required. For example, setting an English (UK) voice recognition title name will be required for SIEE applications, even for applications that only support Spanish.

The use of hiragana and katakana is recommended for Japanese phoneme creation. A phoneme created with Japanese set does not violate this requirement even if romaji or English spelling is used; however, recognition precision may deteriorate.

If it will be difficult to conform to this requirement in applications that re-use masters, contact Private Support through the PlayStation®4 Developer Network website (https://ps4.scedev.net//) in advance.
custom_steps:
Confirm that a voice recognition application complies to the following.
SIE product names and service names are not included.
A number representing a series or a number/expression representing a year alone is not set as part of the title name or short name for a voice recognition title.
"Demo", "trial version", "beta", or "VR" alone is not set as the title name for a voice recognition title.

The following languages according to sales region always have a voice recognition title set.
For Japan in SIEJA: Japanese
SIEA: English (US)
SIEE: English (UK)
For countries other than Japan in SIEJA: English (US)

QA NOTES:
The "title name" will be in the language set for the title name (TITLE) in the param.sfo file for the language set for the voice recognition title name. If the language set does not exist for the title name in param.sfo, the default title name will apply.
Setting a Japanese voice recognition title name is required for SIEJ, even for titles where the title name is English only. For generating Japanese phonemes, setting romaji or spelling words in English for the Japanese is not a violation of this requirement. However, voice recognition may be extremely difficult to perform, depending on the content that is set, so we recommend using hiragana or katakana.
custom_expected:
The voice recognition title name for booting the application is one of the following.
 - Title name.
 - Part of the title name.
 - Shortened title name (some of the characters that comprise the application are included).

Voice recognition phrases for booting the application do not include SIE product names or service names.
A number representing a series or a number/expression representing a year alone is not set as part of the title name or shortened title name for a voice recognition title.
"Demo", "trial version", "beta", or "VR" alone is not set as the title name for a voice recognition title.
The following languages according to sales region always have a voice recognition title set.
SIEJA (Japan): Japanese pronunciation text = Japanese
SIEA: English pronunciation text = English (US)
SIEE: UK English pronunciation text = English (UK)
SIEJA (country/region other than Japan): English pronunciation text = English (US)

Procedures:
Place the cursor on "Application" in the content area of the home screen
Press the OPTIONS button to display the options menu and select "★Check"
Check the "pronunciation.xml:" item

Notes:
When multiple title names are set for a voice recognition title, they must all conform to this requirement.

title: Sony Quality Requirement PS4: R4019 - Confirm the application does not display blank, suspended, or unresponsive screens for longer than 30 seconds
custom_preconds:
The terms blank screen, suspended screen, and unresponsive screen are defined as follows.
• "Blank screen": A state in which there are no visual/audio cues to indicate that there is a game in
progress
• "Suspended screen": A screen in which the displayed image does not change
• "Unresponsive screen": A state in which there is no response to user operation. This does not include
demonstrations, or movies and conversation scenes that are included as part of the game's narrative.
Loading screens defined in R4018 are also not included in the definition of an unresponsive screen.
custom_steps:
(1) Select "Application" in the content area of the home screen
(2) Proceed to a location where the screen continues to be blank, suspended, or unresponsive
custom_expected:
The application does not display blank, suspended, or unresponsive screens for longer than 30 seconds.

Notes
Check all the locations where the screen continues to be blank, suspended, or unresponsive.

title: Sony Quality Requirement PS4: R4023 - The application runs correctly, and all additional contents are correctly accessible, in all possible combinations and orders of patches/additional contents of the relevant master and previous releases (the base

Patch check method
After installing the original application package, install all of the additional content packages released in
the past. In addition, confirm that the patch to submit can be installed. After installing all target packages,
check that the application boots and operates normally.
Additional content check method
After installing the original application package, install all of the additional content packages released in
the past as well as the additional content to submit. In addition, testing with patch combinations that may
occur in user environments is required. After installing all target packages, check that the application
boots and operates normally and all additional content is correctly accessible.
Checking with "★Check"

errors occur.

Perform this test at various points within the application.

About PlayStation®VR compatible applications (the below only applies to VR compatible kits and apps)

Developers of PlayStation®VR compatible applications are required to implement applications in consideration of the possibility of the PlayStation®VR system becoming disconnected while an application is running. In particular, the cable between the VR headset connection adapter and the VR headset can become disconnected.

The connection status to the VR headset can be monitored with the sceHmdGetDeviceInformation() function. The application must not hang or malfunction when a value other than SCE_HMD_DEVICE_STATUS_READY is returned from this function.

If a value other than SCE_HMD_DEVICE_STATUS_READY is returned from the function, then it is recommended to display a message prompting the user to reconnect the PlayStation®VR System. The HmdSetupDialog can be used to display this message, but a custom message is also acceptable. The error message can be displayed in the VR headset or the social screen depending on the application's functionality. However, the HmdSetupDialog is not displayed on the social screen in the separate mode. Note that the social screen must be set to mirroring mode in order to display an error message on it using HmdSetupDialog.

In addition, when a user reconnects the cable, applications are required to make the VR headset usable without the application restarting. Hangs and the application becoming inoperable must not occur at this time. The scene returned to after resuming is up to the application, but whenever possible, it is recommended that applications allow users to continue gameplay without returning to the in-game title screen.
custom_expected: The application runs.

Application developers must consider these requirements when implementing VR applications.
custom_steps:
Check Method

The system software retains users' eye-to-eye distances at a range of 53 to 73 mm. Applications developers must use "★Debug Settings" to set a value in this range and confirm that applications operate properly.

A PlayStation®VR user is not necessarily always using applications with their eye-to-eye distance measured by the system software, therefore application developers must perform testing for arbitrary users in consideration of both when the default eye-to-eye distance is applied and when the eye-to-eye distance measured for each user is applied.

The assigned user for PlayStation®VR can be checked in the screen displayed in "Quick Menu" > "Switch User". In this screen, the user with the PlayStation®VR icon displayed will be the user assigned to PlayStation®VR.
